page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
Basildon New Town was conceived as an over-spill development for London. The town was started about 25 years ago. The houses and factories were to be kept apart, and if you worked in Basildon, the you lived in Basildon. Therefore there was no railway station in the beginning. Today, many people work in London and live in Basildon, and many of the people that work in the factories do not live in Basildon.
Surrounding Basildon is much open space, but the town is expanding all the time. The old villages of Vange, Pitsea,and Laindon have been swallowed up by the expansion of the New Town.
